greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the largest k <= sigma(n) such that n-k and n-(sigma(n)-k) are relatively prime.
comment: a(n) is the largest k <= sigma(n) such that (-n + k) and (n-sigma(n))+k are coprime.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
program: (PARI) A325818(n) = { my(s=sigma(n)); for(i=0, s, if(1==gcd(n-i, n-(s-i)), return(s-i))); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 29 2019
